summary: Mount Elbrus is Russia and Europe's tallest mountain, standing at 18,510 feet (5,642 meters). It's also a dormant volcano and the highest stratovolcano in Eurasia. Located in the Caucasus Mountains, it has two peaks: the western summit (higher) and the eastern summit. The eastern peak was first climbed in 1829, while the western one was reached in 1874 by a British team.
title: Mount Elbrus
